title: Iconic pub from Crocodile Dundee sells after three years on market | ABC NEWS
description: Grazier Angus Brodie has secured the keys to an iconic Aussie pub after years of waiting to settle a deal. The Walkabout Creek Hotel, nestled in the outback Queensland town of McKinlay, was featured in staple Australiana film Crocodile Dundee. Locals have warmly welcomed the new owners, and Angus says he's perfecting his pouring technique for the pub's patrons. description: The CLP government has announced a one-off relief payment for households that have gone three days without power, as it fended off calls to move power underground across Darwin. title: ‚ÄòI‚Äôm coming back‚Äô: Murder trial hears of victim‚Äôs chance meeting with accused in NT court | ABC NEWS
description: Details of a student's chance encounter with his alleged murderer hours before death have been revealed on day two of a Supreme Court murder trial in Darwin.  Isfaqur Rahman had been living in Darwin for just three months after relocating from Bangladesh to study at Charles Darwin University when he was killed in May 2023.   Tiwi Islands man Brendan Kantilla pleaded not guilty to murder, with the defence arguing he was suffering from a substantial mental impairment at the time of the attack.   Olivana Lathouris reports from the Supreme Court in Darwin for ABC News Northern Territory. title: Bondi stabbing inquest hears attacker's psychiatrist gave 'wildly inconsistent' evidence | ABC NEWS
description: An inquest into the Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing attack has spotlighted reform for the mental health sector. The coroner found a psychiatrist who treated attacker Joel Cauchi gave "confusing and wildly inconsistent" evidence at the inquest. Victims' families have called for the psychiatrist to be referred to a regulator. title: Perth is the most expensive city to rent in for the second year in a row | ABC NEWS
description: According to the latest rental affordability index, Perth is the most expensive city to rent in, costing 32% of an average household income, followed by Sydney at 30%.  Regional affordability is down everywhere except for South Australia.   Despite nearly a third of all Australians now renting, social housing stock has not kept pace with rental demand, pushing more Australians to compete in the private rental market.   Original reporting by Briana Shepherd for ABC News WA. Social version by Madeleine Wales for ABC News Digital.  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. It's news when you want it, from Australia's most trusted news organisation. title: Tehran Symphony Orchestra led by a female conductor in an historic first | The World | ABC NEWS
description: For the first time in its history, Iran's oldest and largest symphony orchestra has appointed a female conductor. The decision reveals a slow shift in cultural norms in Iran, as more women defy conservative rule to pursue their passion. Rebecca Johnston reports. title: Deadly floods displace thousands in Thailand, Malaysia and Vietnam | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Thirteen people have been killed in southern Thailand in what's been called the area's worst flooding in 25 years. Monsoon weather is also wreaking havoc in Malaysia where at least eight people are reported to have died. Meanwhile, central Vietnam is still counting the cost of a week of torrential rainfall, which killed dozens and damaged hundreds of thousands of homes. Amanda Robson reports. title: Trump administration orders collection of migrant crime data | The World | ABC NEWS
description: The United States has ordered its embassy to begin collecting data on migrant crime from several countries, including Australia. The Trump administration continues to expand its own anti-immigration policies, with critics warning of the rise of similar divisive political movements around the world. Jared Mondschein from the United States Studies Centre tells The World the Trump administration is "completely changing how the US looks at human rights". title: Crypto crash: How Bitcoin, other digital assets lost $1 trillion in value | The World | ABC News
description: Investors in Bitcoin are reeling as the cryptocurrency's value dropped by hundreds of billions of dollars in recent weeks. The sell-off is part of a broader wipe out of more than a trillion US dollars across major digital assets. Some reports are saying Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies have hit bear market territory. The recent slump has also dealt a significant blow to US President Donald Trump and his family wealth. Eleanor Terrett, host of the 'Crypto in America' podcast, spoke to The World's Girish Sawlani about what's behind the price fall and what lies ahead for investors.
